metadata.title: CVE-2023-41259 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Best Practical Request Tracker (RT) before 4.4.7 and 5.x before 5.0.5allows Information Disclosure via fake or spoofed RT email headers in anemail message or a mail-gateway REST API call.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-41259` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

request-tracker4 - 4.4.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22.04.1
rt4-apache2 - 4.4.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22.04.1
rt4-clients - 4.4.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22.04.1
rt4-db-mysql - 4.4.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22.04.1
rt4-db-postgresql - 4.4.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22.04.1
rt4-db-sqlite - 4.4.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22.04.1
rt4-fcgi - 4.4.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22.04.1
rt4-standalone - 4.4.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: request-tracker4 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22.04.1').
request-tracker5 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
